faq.question: How to create an application using Appblocks?
faq.answer:
Firstly, you have to install the bb-cli with the "npm i @appblocks/bb-cli -g" command. After this, Connect your Appblocks account with your GitHub account.
Now you can try out the command for creating a package block, "bb init package_block_name".

faq.question: How to use blocks from the store in an application?
faq.answer: Create an account with Appblocks, install the bb-cli and connect you Appblocks account with your GitHub. After this step, click the block of your liking from the store (now you are in the block details page). On this page, you'll find a bb cli command to pull and use the block.

faq.question: How to connect the CLI to GitHub?
faq.answer: Use the command "bb login".

faq.question: How to deploy a block?
faq.answer: To deploy the block to the configured cloud infrastructure. Currently, appblocks supports easy deploy to AWS container infrastructure. Use the command "bb deploy <block-name>"

faq.question: How to sign up in Appblocks?
faq.answer: Visit our Store at store.appblocks.com or Spaces at spaces.appblocks.com and you will find the sign up form.

faq.question: How to collaborate using Spaces?
faq.answer: In Spaces, you can have teams, members, roles, apps, etc.

licensing.title: Licensing
licensing.desc: Vestibulum sit amet elit risus.Vivamus in erat dignissim.

faq.question: Do licenses have an expiry date? Is there any fees involved (renewals or royalties)?
faq.answer: Currently it is only MIT license which is free and need not be renewed.

faq.question: What are the services/permissions provided with the MIT license?
faq.answer:
• Use the code in commercial applications: For example, a company can create a proprietary piece of software that includes all or part of the original open source code, then charge money for that software.
  • Modify the code: In other words, developers can change/update the code however they’d like.
  • Distribute copies of the code and any modifications: As long as the original copyright notice and the license itself are included, an organization can distribute and sell copies or modified versions of the code.
  • Sublicense the code: This means you can incorporate the original code into a modification with a stricter license.

faq.question: How to receive updates for a free block?
faq.answer: For updates, find the block in the Store and check if there are newer versions released.

faq.question: Is it legal to resell an MIT licensed block?
faq.answer: Yes, you can.

faq.question: Is it legal to redistribute an MIT licensed block?
faq.answer: Yes, you can with MIT license.

faq.question: Is it legal to edit an MIT licensed block?
faq.answer: Yes, you can with MIT license.

faq.question: What are the activities to be avoided with an MIT-licensed block?
faq.answer:
• You can’t hold the code author(s) legally liable for any reason.
  • You also can’t delete the copyright notice and original license from your version of the code.

cli.title: CLI
cli.desc: Vestibulum sit amet elit risus.Vivamus in erat dignissim.

faq.question: How to install the CLI
faq.answer: Use the command "npm i @appblocks/bb-cli" in the your command prompt.

faq.question: What is block.config.json?
faq.answer: block.config.json is where cli stores critical information about the blocks. The data from this config helps CLI to make informed decision on how to handle your blocks. configs are usually kept both in your git repo and appblocks registry. if block is a package block, user should manually push it to registry using bb push-config

faq.question: How to install the CLI in different OS
faq.answer: CLI is built using javascript and so it needs Node in your machine to work irrespective of the OS. Step one would be to install node. Use nvm or install directly from nodejs website. after that, install bb-cli from npmjs. make sure to install bb-cli globally.

faq.question: How to configure the bb-cli?
faq.answer: User can user bb config command to view and edit cli configuration. use bb config --help  for more information

faq.question: How to delete a block that was created accidentally?
faq.answer: Use "bb delete <block-name>" for deleting blocks. This will also try to delete the block repo from github (if you are using github)

faq.question: Having to restart the emulator to see the changes in a function block. How to fix this?
faq.answer: It is due to limitation in node's import strategies. Based on https://github.com/nodejs/help/issues/2751#issuecomment-1075535742, we have implementated a solution. Make NODE_ENV=development and it will work.

faq.question: How to inject custom values to an environment from the block?
faq.answer: All values in .env inside block dirs are parsed and added to respective envs (.env.view for view blocks and .env.fucntions for function blocks) on start. Just add a .env inside your block directory

faq.question: I have multiple blocks running on my system, consuming system resources. Is there a solution to stop all blocks without manually accessing each block directory and running "bb stop"?
faq.answer:
Yes there is! CLI has a one time stop all facility. use stop with "-g" from anywhere.
"bb stop -g". CLI will try to located all blocks and stop them for you.

faq.question: Why is HMR not working for fedearted modules
faq.answer: CLI generated webpack config has the setup for @module-federation/fmr . Uncomment the code and add you container name and port. Do this in every federated component where you want HMR.

faq.question: What is the difference between ‘bb create’ and ‘bb init’?
faq.answer: "bb init" is used to create a package block. "bb create" is used to create a block; UI, Function, or Shared Block. This command will prompt you to choose the type of block. It will also create a sample template.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: react

publishing_and_using_blocks.title: Publishing and using blocks
publishing_and_using_blocks.desc: Vestibulum sit amet elit risus.Vivamus in erat dignissim.

faq.question: How to find a specific block?
faq.answer: Visit the Store. There are filters, and search to easily find blocks.

faq.question: How to publish a block?
faq.answer: To publish a block, your block has to be first deployed. Go to the manage blocks page and find the publish button. You will then fill a form and wait for Appblocks to review and publish your block.

faq.question: How to install a block?
faq.answer: To install a block, you have to have installed the bb-cli first. Go to the block details page of this particular block and find the installation command on the right hand side of this page. Copy and paste it in your CLI.

faq.question: How to find the reason for a particular block publish request getting rejected?
faq.answer: The reason for rejecting a publish request will be shown in the review status tab of the Publish a block page.

faq.question: How to delist a block?
faq.answer: To delist a block, go to the manage blocks page and find the delist button. If you don't see the delist button, it means that your block is not published.

spaces.desc: Vestibulum sit amet elit risus.Vivamus in erat dignissim.

faq.question: What is a space?
faq.answer: A space helps your organizations and teams to collaboratively work on applications and blocks and allows you to manage accesses of all these, all in one workspace.

faq.question: How can you manage access to appblocks resources via spaces?
faq.answer: In Appblocks, each space admin can decide the access controls of the members in that space. A space admin can create teams and roles, making managing access of each added member easier.

faq.question: How to change my password?
faq.answer: To change password, go to the Profile Settings page shown in the left side navigation menu. You will find the change password option, where you have to enter the current and new passwords.

faq.question: Can the invited user access all the resources in the space?
faq.answer: An invited user has access to only actions that the space owner has given the member rights to.

faq.question: How many spaces, teams, and roles a member can be assigned?
faq.answer: There is no limit on the number of spaces, teams or roles you can create. You can also have any number of members added.

faq.question: How to create a new space?
faq.answer: To create a new space, you can either click on "Create New" inside the Home page list or click on "Create New Space" on the Spaces list in the left side navigation menu.

faq.question: How to invite other people to a space?
faq.answer: To invite a person to your space, standing in the space - members tab, click the "New Member" button and send invites.

faq.question: How to edit a space name after creating it?
faq.answer: Once you create a space, you will find it in a list in the left side navigation menu. Choose the space, and go to its Settings tab in the space details page. Click on the text field, make changes and save.

faq.question: How to delete a space?
faq.answer: Currently, deleting a space is not an option.

faq.question: What problem does Appblocks solve?
faq.answer:
"Not all Apps require re-engineering. Much of it can be built using reusable blocks of code within composable standards."
Large enterprises use their own composable framework enabling reusability and maintaining code quality. But these are not open to the rest of the world. Appblocks addresses this need by developing a Universal Composable Framework that can be adopted by any individual developer or organization and also enabling collaboration between them.

faq.question: How to change my password?
faq.answer: To change password, go to the Profile Settings page shown in the left side navigation menu. You will find the change password option, where you have to enter the current and new passwords.
